title: 110_hr3234
content: HSA Improvement and Expansion Act of 2007 - Amends Internal Revenue Code provisions relating to health savings accounts (HSAs) to: (1) allow HSAs to incorporate flexible spending and health reimbursement arrangements, (2) increase the annual HSA contribution limitation, (3) permit the use of HSAs to purchase health insurance. (4) allow the payment of certain medical expenses incurred before the establishment of an HSA. (5) allow veterans eligible for service-connected disability benefits to establish an HSA. And (6) allow spouses to make increased catch-up contributions to a single HSA.
